## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}
data1 <- read.csv("data/Yeongheung complex full.csv")

summary(data1)

ggplot(data1) + geom_histogram(aes(x=windMax), bins=10, fill = "blue")

data2 <- data1 %>% group_by(date) %>% mutate(dailytmp = mean(tmp))

p1 <- ggplot(data2, aes(x=dailytmp, y=windMax)) + geom_point(color = "blue", size = 3, alpha = 0.8)

p2 <- ggplot(data1, aes(x=dew, y=windMax)) + geom_point(color = "blue", size = 3, alpha = 0.8)

p3 <- ggplot(data1, aes(x=relHum, y=windMax)) + geom_point(color = "blue", size = 3, alpha = 0.8)

p1
p2
p3
```
